1.name: The Birth of a Nation
1.description: The Stoneman family finds its friendship with the Camerons affected by the Civil War, both fighting in opposite armies. The development of the war in their lives plays through to Lincoln's assassination and the birth of the Ku Klux Klan.

2.name: Les vampires
2.description: An intrepid reporter and his loyal friend battle a bizarre secret society of criminals known as The Vampires.

3.name: Der Golem
3.description: In this version of the golem legend, the golem, a clay statue brought to life by Rabbi Loew in 16th century Prague to save the Jews from the ongoing brutal persecution by the city's rulers,...                See full summary »

4.name: The Cheat
4.description: A venal, spoiled stockbroker's wife impulsively embezzles $10,000 from the charity she chairs and desperately turns to a Burmese ivory trader to replace the stolen money.

5.name: Alice in Wonderland
5.description: Alice goes with her sister to a picnic and then she falls asleep and starts dreaming about a wonderland full of talking animals and walking playing cards.

6.name: A Fool There Was
6.description: A married diplomat falls hopelessly under the spell of a predatory woman.

7.name: The Regeneration
7.description: A boy surrounded by violence grows up to become an infamous gangster.

8.name: Carmen
8.description: In order to help her smuggler kinsmen, a sultry gypsy seduces and corrupts an officer of the Civil Guard turning him into a traitor and murderer.

9.name: Hypocrites
9.description: The parallel stories of a modern preacher and a medieval monk, Gabriel the Ascetic, who is killed by an ignorant mob for making a nude statue representing Truth, which is also represented by a ghostly naked girl who flits throughout the film.

10.name: Fanchon, the Cricket
10.description: A young wild girl Fanchon ( Mary Pickford ) lives in a forest with her eccentric grandmother who is suspected by the villagers of being a witch. The unkempt Fanchon suffers from her ...                See full summary »

11.name: Ghosts
11.description: Helen and Manders are in love and wish to marry. Her parents object to his poverty and want her to marry Alving, a notorious rake, who is wealthy and powerful. Manders protests. The family ...                See full summary »

12.name: The Coward
12.description: Confederate soldier Frank Winslow is terrified of the war and eventually runs away from battle. But when he finds himself behind enemy lines with vital information, he must decide between ...                See full summary »

13.name: Filibus
13.description: Skypirate Filibus commits robberies from her airship, while a dedicated detective attempts to put a stop to it.

14.name: A Butterfly on the Wheel
14.description: Peggy Admaston and her husband are socialites whose happy marriage quickly deteriorates as Admaston neglects his young wife for business matters, and is unaware of her loneliness and ...                See full summary »

15.name: Posle smerti
15.description: Andrei lives a secluded life with his aunt, studying and thinking about his now-deceased mother. His friend Tsenin is concerned, and tries to get Andrei to accompany him to social events. ...                See full summary »

16.name: Civilization
16.description: Christ takes on the form of a pacifist count to end a senseless war.

17.name: Carmen
17.description: A Spanish soldier falls under the spell of a fiery gypsy girl named Carmen. His obsession with her leads to his ruin.

18.name: Sin
18.description: Italian peasant girl deserts her fiancé for wealthy gangster and departs for America.

19.name: The Italian
19.description: An immigrant leaves his sweetheart in Italy to find a better life across the sea in the grimy slums of New York. They are eventually reunited and marry. But life in New York is hard and ...                See full summary »

20.name: The White Pearl
20.description: Nancy, a sea captain's daughter, loves a rich importer's son, but his father objects to their marriage. Nancy takes a sea voyage to forget the boy, but he stows away and rescues her when ...                See full summary »

22.name: The Devil's Daughter
22.description: When her lover deserts her, Gioconda Dianti seeks revenge by wrecking the lives of other men. When Lucio Settala, a famous sculptor, meets Gioconda and asks her to pose for him, she sets ...                See full summary »

23.name: The Golden Chance
23.description: Mary Denby becomes a seamstress after her husband Steve wastes their money on booze. Her employer provides her as an escort to accompany millionaire Roger Manning. Her husband tries ...                See full summary »

24.name: Young Romance
24.description: Young Romance, released in 1915, is a recent rediscovery that forever silences the claim that refined comedy cannot be conveyed via the screen. This disguise plot, worthy of an Elizabethan ...                See full summary »

25.name: Assunta Spina
25.description: Assunta Spina is a tragedy set in Naples at the beginning of the twentieth century. Assunta and Michele are in love but others come between them and there is much jealousy. They fight and ...                See full summary »

26.name: The Warrens of Virginia
26.description: As the Civil War begins Ned Burton leaves his Southern love Agatha Warren and joins the Union army. He is later protected and saved from death by Agatha in spite of her loyalty to the South.

27.name: The Arab
27.description: An old sheik punishes his son Jamil for robbing a caravan by giving his horse to the wronged merchant. The horse is sold to a Turkish general then given to a Christian missionary Mary ...                See full summary »

28.name: The Heart of the Blue Ridge
28.description: Mountain girl Plutina lives with her grandfather, refuses to marry moonshiner Dan Hodges, preferring instead Zeke, a young farmer. When Zeke learns that Dan, in revenge, shot Plutina's pet ...                See full summary »

29.name: Inspiration
29.description: A young sculptor searches for the perfect model to inspire his work.

30.name: The Girl of the Golden West
30.description: Road agent Ramerrez hides out in his girlfriend's store where the Sheriff knows him to be. The Sheriff plays The Girl a game of cards to decide Ramerrez's future. She wins. She later saves him from a hanging. She rides off with him.

31.name: Old Heidelberg
31.description: Karl Heinrich is the heir to the throne of the small European principality of Rutania, but he's a lonely child, not allowed to play with other children and knowing little about life outside...                See full summary »

32.name: The Clemenceau Case
32.description: Bara as the wife-vampire - her third picture.

33.name: The Battle Cry of Peace
33.description: Enemy agents under the leadership of "Emanon" conspire with pacifists to keep the American defense appropriations down at a time when forces of the enemy are preparing to invade. The ...                See full summary »

34.name: The Lily and the Rose
34.description: To the dismay of Allison Edwards, her bookworm, adoring neighbor, Mary Randolph, falls in love with and marries Jack Van Norman, a rich and handsome former football star. After a few months...                See full summary »

35.name: Martyrs of the Alamo
35.description: The story of the defense of the mission-turned-fortress by 185 Texans against an overwhelming Mexican army in 1836.

36.name: The Galley Slave
36.description: Francesca Brabaut, who married an artist against her father's advice, regrets her decision when her husband Antoine, in debt, sends her to his misanthropic uncle to plead for money. After ...                See full summary »

38.name: Maciste
38.description: A young girl, pursued by a band of conspirators, hides in a movie theatre where she watches the film Cabiria. She determines to seek the aid of that film's strongman, Maciste. When she ...                See full summary »

39.name: Runaway June
39.description: Episode 1: "The Runaway Bride" It is the wedding day of June Moore and the entire household is all confusion, excitement, and bustle, from Donnie, the pet collie of June, to Mr. Moore, ...                See full synopsis »

42.name: Life Without Soul
42.description: A young man gives life to a statue with disastrous results.

43.name: The Lamb
43.description: Gerald, the somewhat frail son of a wealthy New York family, is bested at the beach by Bill, a strapping young cowboy from Arizona. His fiancée Mary, ashamed of Gerald's "yellow streak", ...                See full summary »

46.name: The Prince and the Pauper
46.description: A poor boy named Tom Canty and Edward, the Prince of Wales exchange identities but events force the pair to experience each other's lives as well.

47.name: Far from the Madding Crowd
47.description: A girl farmer weds a faithless sergeant who is killed by her suitor, and realises she loves the bailiff.

49.name: The Soul of Broadway
49.description: Grace Leonard, a typical woman of the New York stage, beautiful but old in sin, seduces William Craig, who becomes a thief in order to shower luxuries upon her. He is sentenced to prison ...                See full summary »

50.name: Destruction
50.description: Fernande marries a man and schemes to get his wealth when his expected death occurs. But he dies before he can change his will. She next tries to kill the son who inherits, but he outfoxes her.
